Manx: MANNIN VEEN.
English: DEAR ISLE OF MAN

Manx: Yioaree! my t’ou la’al dy ve
English: Stranger! If you want to be

Manx: Reillt ayns sauchys, shee, as fea;
English: Ruled in safety, peace and quiet;

Manx: My t’ou shirrey aash dhyt hene,
English: If you seek rest for yourself,

Manx: Eunys sheelt, dynloght, as glen ;
English: Sober delight, sinless, and pure;

Manx: Ayns shoh vees oo trean as reen :
English: Here you will be valiant and tough:

Manx: Tar, eisht tar, dys Mannin veen !
English: Come, then come, to dear Mann !

Manx: My t’ou imlee ayns dy lheill,
English: If you are humble in your bearing,

Manx: As da mooadys dyn cur geill;
English: And pay no heed to greatness;

Manx: My tou noi dagh nhee ta dewI,
English: If you are against every cruelty,

Manx: Reddyn taitnysagh dan Jeull ;
English: Things the devil enjoys;

Manx: My tou dooinney mie as creen,
English: If you are a good and wise man,

Manx: Tar, O tar, dys Mannin veen !
English: Come, O come, to dear Mann!

Manx: My ta gennallys dty oaie,
English: If there’s merriment in your face,

Manx: Graih da’n naboo soiljagh chaiee ;
English: Showing eternal love for neighbour;

Manx: My tou gientyn meij erreeish ;
English: If you generate tenderness of compassion

Manx: Lheids ta cronnagh' meenid Chreest ;
English: Such as discerns the meekness of Christ;

Manx: Cha vow boayll er fei ny cruin
English: You won’t find a spot in all the world

Manx: Sheshaght lheids tayns Mannin veen.
English: Such company as there is in dear Mann.

Manx: Shoh yn raad ta trimmid chree
English: This is where heaviness of heart,

Manx: Feddin gerjagh, aaght, as shee;
English: Finds comfort, lodging and peace;

Manx: Keeshidyr cha vel son ginsh,
English: No taxman can tell,

Manx: Eearoo dty uinnagyn son keesh ;
English: The number of your windows for tax;

Manx: Cabbil, na dty vooinjer hene,
English: (Neither will your) Horses, or your own relatives,

Manx: Coontit vees ayns Mannin veen.
English: Be counted in dear Mann.

Manx: Hreoltagh, eaisht, as gow my ghoo,
English: Traveller listen, and take my word,

Manx: Cha vel aalid cheerey smoo
English: There’s no greater geographical beauty

Manx: Boayl dy vaik oo ny t’ayns shoh ;
English: Where you’ll see what is here;

Manx: Cha vel nhee ta noi yn traw;
English: There is nothing that’s against the grain (tide) ;

Manx: Tar, eisht, Yioaree, fow dhyt hene
English: Come, then, Stranger, find for yourself

Manx: Cummal bwoiagh ayns Mannin veen !
English: A handsome dwelling in dear Mann!

Manx: LLIAM DHOUNN.
English: BROWN WILLIAM.
